str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Zacchaeus, a Jewish tax-gatherer. Of Hebrew origin; Zacchaeus, an Israelite.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Half. Neuter of a derivative from an inseparable prefix akin to hama and meaning semi-; half.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Poor, destitute, spiritually poor, either in a good sense (humble devout persons) or bad.
And, even, also, namely.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From a compound of sukon and a derivative of phaino; to be a fig-informer, 'sycophant', i.e. to defraud.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From apo and didomi; to give away, i.e. Up, over, back, etc.
Four-fold, four times as much. From tessares and a derivative of the base of pleistos; quadruple.
